{"step_by_step_thinking": "Brown adipose tissue, also known as brown fat, is a type of fat that is found in various locations in the body. It is known to be present around the scapula (A), in subcutaneous tissue (B), and around blood vessels (C). However, it is not typically found around the adrenal cortex (D). The adrenal cortex is primarily involved in the production of hormones such as cortisol and aldosterone, not in the storage or production of fat.", "answer_choice": "D"}
